info.name: Cranial Nerves
info.description: There are 12 pair of cranial nerves.  The Olfactory nerves (I) are associated with the telencephalon.  The Optic nerves (II) are associated with the diencephalon.  The Oculomotor (III) and Trochlear (IV) nerves are associated with the midbrain (mesencephalon).  The Trigeminal (V), Abducens (VI), Facial (VII) and Vestibulocochlear (VIII) are associated with the pons (metencephalon).  The Glossopharyngeal (IX), Vagus (X), Hypoglossal (XII) are associated with the medulla (myelencephalon).  The Accessory (XI) nerves originate in the cervical spinal cord.
